meanings.definition: To cause (a liquid) to flow in a steady stream
meanings.sent1: She was pouring milk into her cereal.
meanings.sent2: The bartender was pouring drinks for the customers.
meanings.sent3: The magician kept pouring water into a hat, but it never filled up.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were pouring out of her like a waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The overflowing river was pouring down the mountainside.

meanings.sent1: It was pouring outside, so we decided to stay indoors.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds signaled that it would start pouring soon.
meanings.sent3: The rain was pouring so hard that even the ducks sought shelter.
meanings.sent4: Tears were pouring down her cheeks as she watched the sad movie.
meanings.sent5: The storm was pouring rain like a giant faucet turned on high.

meanings.sent1: The pouring of the tea was done with great care.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the pouring of water from the pitcher.
meanings.sent3: The pouring of the wine at the wedding was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent4: The pouring of concrete for the new sidewalk was completed yesterday.
meanings.sent5: The pouring of the molten metal into the mold created a new sculpture.
